title: Edzell Blue Door Walk Route

images.title: Russel Wills / River North Esk from Gannochy Bridge
images.caption: River North Esk from Gannochy Bridge

images.title: Martyn Gorman / The River North Esk
images.caption: The North Esk, a famous salmon river, flowing in a deep gorge in the grounds of "The Burn" house.

images.title: Lloyd Housley / Old Tower in the Blue Door woods at Glen Esk near Edzell
images.caption: Old Tower in the woods at Glen Esk near Edzell. Resides almost hidden up above the "Blue Door" walk just short of the Rocks of Solitude.

images.title: Russel Wills / Burn of Kirkton tumbles into River North Esk
images.caption: Burn of Kirkton tumbles into River North Esk. A neat footbridge crosses the burn.

images.title: Russel Wills / Salmon leap and remains of suspension bridge
images.caption: Salmon leap and remains of suspension bridge

images.title: Lloyd Housley / The Burn House Suspension Bridge, Glen Esk
images.caption: The Burn House Suspension Bridge, Glen Esk. Old hunting party 'Loups Bridge' above the salmon leap.

images.title: Russel Wills / Beech trees beside the riverside walk
images.caption: Beech trees beside the riverside walk

description: This popular walk in Edzell takes you along a splendid river gorge on the North Esk river in Glen Esk. On the way there's lots of pretty waterfalls and interesting geological formations as you head through the area known as the Rocks of Solitude. The route starts in the village and heads north along the river to Gannochy Tower and Saw Mill Cottage. Here you cross the Gannochy Bridge where you'll find the blue door which leads to the grounds of 18th century Burn House. The route continues north passing the picturesque spot where the Burn of Kirkton flows into the North Esk. A little further on you'll come to the Loups Bridge where you can see the Salmon Leap and the remains of the suspension bridge. You continue north to the Rocks of Solitude and Doulie Cottage where you turn south to Woodburn and Brackens Lodge. The route then rejoins the river at Gannochy Bridge and heads back into Edzell.
